articles.title: Camping
articles.contents:
Contents
Camping
What to pack
Camping map

Off-site Lodging
Windsor Mansion Inn
Fairfield Inn and Suites, White River Junction


Camping
Attendees seeking for the full experience will join us to camp in the garden.
We have reserved the EFGH and IJKL sections of the garden for wedding guests to camp.
EFGH has 4 preexisting deluxe tents.
With cots and blankets, each deluxe tent can fit 6 persons.
If your party size is 4-6 or you have other individuals you‚Äôd like to stay with, let us know.

Families might be a good fit.
If you have camping gear (tent, pad, quilt / blanket), please bring it.
Otherwise, let us know when RSVPing and we‚Äôll place you in one of the deluxe tents or find gear for you to borrow.
We will also be setting up extra tents from our surplus gear.
If you have extra gear, you can volunteer that when RSVPing.
What to pack
If you have these, bring them:
layers (it can get chilly at night)
shelter (tent / tarp)
padding (pad or mat)
insulation (50¬∞ sleeping bag / quilt / comforter / blankets)
pillow
water bottle
hat
sunglasses
sunscreen
bug spray
swimsuit
towel
ear plugs (for sleeping)
rain jacket / umbrella
capable shoes for the sunday run
headlight (phone flashlight could substitute)
portable charger / power bank to recharge phone.
festivities and games
snacks, especially if you have special dietary needs
musical instruments
No on-site power though some portable power will be brought in for the reception tent and AV system.
There will be drinking water around the venue in portable coolers.
Camping map
Great River Outfitters provides some camping info and rules.
We‚Äôve highlighted the event and camping locations on this map:
Wedding camping and event locations in the Path of Life GardenOvernight guests should park in the grass lot at 43.512089, -72.402431,
especially critical¬†if you are arriving after the Great River Outfitter office is closed.
Off-site Lodging
For guests that do not want to stay on the premises,
we have hotel recommendations with group rates.
Mother Becky has found two hotels for wedding guests:
Windsor Mansion Inn and Fairfield Inn and Suites White River Junction.
Windsor Mansion Inn
Address: 153 Pembroke Road, Windsor, 05089, VT
(only 3 miles from the wedding site)
Has 17 rooms arranged over 3 floors (no elevator) and they vary in price and features.
Nine rooms are still available as of May 25 for July 23‚Äì25 (two-night minimum on the weekend).
This is an elegant, historic inn that has housed past presidents and was totally renovated in 2016.
Andy, the proprietor, is offering a discount of $10 off the non-suite rooms and $14 off the suite rooms, or $142, $155 or $175/night + tax.
Rooms are not refundable after June 8 (within 45 days of event).
Breakfast for two is included.
A couple rooms ‚Äî ‚ÄòMiddle‚Äô and ‚ÄòArt Deco Suite‚Äô ‚Äî can accommodate a third person.
Reservations can be made directly by calling 802-674-4112 and mentioning the Himmelstein/Le/Hirschey Wedding group.

Expand this for Windsor Mansion Inn room descriptions
Note: not all rooms are available July 23‚Äì25.
Calvin Coolidge Room: 1 Queen Bed, Private porch, Antique show fireplace, Library access
Theodore Roosevelt Suite: 1 Queen Bed, Deep soaking tub, Propane fireplace, Library access
Woodrow Wilson Suite: 1 King Bed, Petite claw foot tub, Fireplace, Private porch, Library Access
Bungalow: 1 King Bed, Heated towel rack, Kitchenette, Private exterior entrance
Evarts Suite: 1 Queen Bed, Soaking Tub, Corner room with view, Antique show fireplace
Gordon Ramsey Suite: 1 Queen Bed, Clawfoot tub, Antique show fireplace, Shared balcony with views
Auguste Rodin Suite: 1 Queen Bed, Antique show fireplace, Shared balcony with views
Art Deco Suite: Partial Lake View
Writer‚Äôs Suite: 1 Queen Bed, Petite Clawfoot tub, Antique show fireplace with built in bookshelves
Federal Room: 1 Queen Bed, Claw foot tub and shower, Antique show fireplace
Gray Room: 1 Queen Bed, Glass shower, Antique show fireplace
Crocked Frame Room: 1 Queen Bed, Petite claw foot tub and shower
Middle Room: 1 Queen Bed, Twin size sofa bed, Petite claw foot tub and shower
Yellow Room: 1 Queen Bed, Petite claw foot tub and shower, Propane show fireplace
Hunter‚Äôs Room: Queen Bed, Glass Shower, Propane Show Fireplace
French Room: 1 Queen Bed with shower
East Lake Room: 1 Full Bed, Glass Shower
Fairfield Inn and Suites, White River Junction
Address: 102 Ballardvale Dr, White River Junction, VT
20 rooms are blocked until 5 PM on June 23 at a rate of $135/night + tax and can be booked for one or two nights.
Room fees are refundable up until 24 hours before arrival date.
Some rooms can accommodate 5 adults (two queen beds and a sofa bed).
Reservations can be made online here
or by calling 802-291-9911 and mentioning the Himmelstein/Le/Hirschey Wedding group.

articles.title: FAQ
articles.description:
Please scroll down to see all the questions and answers.
If you have additional questions, send them directly to Daniel <daniel.himmelstein@gmail.com> and we'll add them here.
articles.contents:
Contents
Are pets allowed?
Are children allowed?
Dress
Running Course
Final notes
Where do I shower?
How can I help?
Can I bring a +1?
Who helped build the website?
Who can make it?
Who‚Äôs doing what?
What did you write us?

Are pets allowed?
Unfortunately, the venue doesn‚Äôt allow pets.
We‚Äôre sorry but you‚Äôll have to leave your furry friends at home.
Are children allowed?
Yes!
Bring your babies, and we‚Äôll teach them Ultimate.
Dress
There is no dress code.
But you can help us commemmorate the occasion by wearing creative and colorful attire for the Saturday ceremony and reception.
Dress wild! The more extravagant and ugly the better.
Oh behave!The event will be on grass.
Do not wear stiletto heels.
Prefer high-performing footwear or bring a change of shoes, such that your celebrate to your fullest ability.
See Camping for helpful attire for the whole weekend.
Running Course
The Off the Grid 5k will be Sunday at 9 AM. The race starts and ends at the stone flower.
It goes around the Path of Life Garden and adjacent farm in a clockwise direction.
Run two laps.
Starting at the Stone Flower,
run clockwise on the perimeter gravel road that goes around the deluxe tents.
Continue past the reception tent. Do not cross the railroad tracks.
Never during the race will you cross the railroad.
Next you‚Äôll turn onto a path in the woods and cross a stream that divides the Path of Life Garden and the neighboring farm.
Take a left out of the woods to continue around the perimeter of the farm, going around the solar farm.
Continue around the entire farm, staying to the left, except not crossing the railroad.
When exiting the garm, The path onto the lower bridge to return from to Path of Life garden is narrow.
The bridge is slanted and slippery. Use caution.
Continue along the grass road in the Path of Life garden.
If it‚Äôs your second lap, stop at the finish line.
Off the Grid 5K running course superimposed on aerial imageryFinal notes
We can‚Äôt wait to see you in just a couple days at the Loveroo Club wedding.
It has been an exciting time in the Upper Valley region, with a major storm causing erosion and downed trees.
The dam upstream of the Path of Life Garden hit outflows of 19,000 cubic feet per second, compared to a historical median of 3,000 on this day.
The moon is poised to go full buck on Friday night to ring in the festivities.
And Amtrak resumed passenger service on its historic Vermonter line, so attendees can expect twice daily train sightings.
The ceremony starts at 4:00 pm Saturday sharp.
Please arrive by 3:30 pm.
The river trip on Friday departs at 2:00 pm.
Arrive by 1:30 pm.
The weather looks great with highs of 80¬∞F and lows of 55¬∞F, with a slight chance of rain.
Nighttime temperatures can be a bit chilly, so bring an outer layer and insulation for sleeping.
If you‚Äôre arriving early Friday for the river trip and need to refrigerate something for the potluck,
Artisan Eats is lending us some refrigerator space. When you enter the Path of Life Garden via Great River Outfitters,
ask for the Artisan Eats fridge, which is in the same building.
We also have coolers at the event tent, and near the deluxe tents.
Best to bring any booze to these coolers rather than Artisans Eat.
We‚Äôll probably have a propane grill going at some points over the weekend at one of the deluxe tents.
If you‚Äôre coming by way of the Dartmouth Coach or Amtrak and need a ride, let us know.
We‚Äôll try to recruit some volunteers to pick you up. In this neck of the woods, hitchhiking is more reliable than Uber or Lyft.
Let us know if you‚Äôd like to give a short speech at the reception.
Where do I shower?
There are two shower stalls, which operate using solar bags provided by the Outfitters.
There is also a cold water shower at the shop.
The Connecticut River is also quite clean and refreshing at this latitude.
Please note that the facilities are minimal in general.
How can I help?
We‚Äôd love your help in making our wedding special.
Here are some examples of ways you could assist, inspired by actual invitees!
Can lend my strength for setup
Can help clean up
I‚Äôm a licensed airman and can take a drone video
Can play cello
Can bring a lawn game called King Kubb
Have AV skills
Have a 10kW generator you could borrow (Let us know if you have this!)
Can make wildflower bouquets
Can do Trang‚Äôs hair
Can be in charge of coffee
If you‚Äôd like to offer a skill or lend an item, let us know in your RSVP or by email.
See also the volunteer spreadsheet, where you can add yourself with ‚ÄúSuggest Changes‚Äù mode.
Can I bring a +1?
If we were aware of a likely +1,
we probably named them in your invite or sent them a separate invite.
If we didn‚Äôt, you can still list them as part of your party in the RSVP form or ask us separately.
And we will confirm that the additional guest doesn‚Äôt exceed capacity restrictions.
Who helped build the website?
Huge thanks to our dear friend, Silvia Canel√≥n, for creating this beautiful website.
And Trang‚Äôs sister Ng·ªçc for creating the invitation video.






Who can make it?

# A tibble: 2 √ó 2
  will_attend          n
  <chr>            <dbl>
1 Can't make it üò≠    26
2 Yes!!!             109


# A tibble: 3 √ó 2
  will_camp n_camps
  <chr>       <dbl>
1 Maybe          13
2 No             38
3 Yes            58

Who‚Äôs doing what?

# A tibble: 6 √ó 2
  activity                    participation
  <fct>                               <dbl>
1 Friday River Trip                      55
2 Friday Potluck Dinner                  83
3 Saturday Lunch                         92
4 Saturday Ceremony                     109
5 Saturday Dinner & Reception           109
6 Sunday Off-the-grid 5K Run             66

What did you write us?



Who‚Äôs responsible?

articles.title: Registry
articles.contents:
We DO NOT have a registry!
We know you love us and would like to get us a gift, but your early RSVP is the biggest gift.
No need to purchase anything!
But, if you really must, we will accept dumpster dived produce or donations via the lightning network.

articles.title: Results
articles.description: Results and acknowledgements from the wedding.
articles.contents:
Contents
Race Results
Volunteers
Vendors
Music

Race Results
On Sunday, many elite and recreational runners braved the rain and fatigue to run the Off-the-Grid 5K Race.
Course details are available in the FAQ.
We are grateful to former Hanover High Cross Country coach, Jim Eakin, for proper timing and setting of the finish line.
Here are the results:


Volunteers
Thanks everyone who helped make the wedding wonderful.
We very much wanted the event to be a collaborative one that celebrated not just us
but also the talents of our guests.
A special thank you to the following individuals who played major roles:
Kurt Wheeler ‚Äì Ceremony Officiant
Daniel Lelchuk ‚Äì Cello
Jim Eakin ‚Äì Race Officiant
Josh Himmelstein ‚Äì Ring Bearer & Airman
Nadia Penrod ‚Äì Yoga Instructor
Liz Marshall ‚Äì Wedding Cake
Amanda John ‚Äì Photographer
Mathew Griffin & Jordan Hunter: Improv Workshop Leads
Brandon Johnson ‚Äì Audio/Video Engineer
Bennett Prescott ‚Äì Audio Advisor
Marissa & Diego Legrand whose 2018 campground wedding was a major inspiration
Becky Hirschey ‚Äì Master of Logistics
And everyone else who made the wedding possible and helped along the way.
Vendors
We did have the help of several paid vendors, which we‚Äôd like to acknowledge:
Path of Life Garden & Great River Outfitters for the venue, campground, and river trip
Barefoot Gourmet for reception dinner catering
Blood‚Äôs catering for the event tent, table, and chair rental
SILO Distillery for reception alcohol catering (a Vermont licensed alcohol caterer required by venue / laws)
Artisan Eats for lunch sandwiches / wraps
Best Septic for porta-potty and hand-washing station rental
Home Depot for the generator rental
Music
For music, we made several Spotify playlists by occasion:
Bonfire,
Romantic background,
Prime dance,
Late night,
and Special.

articles.title: RSVP
articles.contents:
We are no longer accepting responses.
If you need to make changes to your RSVP, please send Daniel an email at daniel.himmelstein@gmail.com.

articles.title: Schedule
articles.contents:
Add to Calendar
Friday, July 23rd
River trip

1:30 pm ‚Äì 5:00 pm
Explore the Connecticut river via kayak, canoe, or paddle board!

The river trip goes ~4 miles down the Connecticut River. The shuttle will leave at 2 pm, so you must be there at 1:30 pm to fill out a waiver and undergo an orientation. Advanced notice (via the RSVP) is required for this activity.
Potluck dinner

6:30 pm ‚Äì 8:30 pm
Anything made or purchased with love is appreciated!

If you‚Äôre able to bring something, great! If you‚Äôre traveling from afar or unable to bring anything, that is okay.
Socializing

8:30 pm ‚Äì 11:00 pm
Beer. Bonfire. Bliss.
Saturday, July 24th
MYOB

08:00 am ‚Äì 11:00 am
Make your own bed/breakfast/bagel. And coffee.
Calibration yoga

09:00 am ‚Äì 10:00 am
An alignment-based practice session that transcends boundaries.
Unstructured joy

11:00 am ‚Äì 3:00 pm
Water activities, yard games, flying discs, sculpture garden tour
Unconventional ceremony

4:00 pm ‚Äì 5:00 pm
You don‚Äôt want to miss this. See FAQ for the undress code.
Reception

5:30 pm ‚Äì 8:00 pm
You especially don‚Äôt want to miss this.
Party

8:00 pm ‚Äì 
Dancing with the Driftwood band.
Sunday, July 25th
MYOB

08:00 am ‚Äì 11:00 am
Good morning. Get yourself ready for the race!
Off-the-grid 5K Run

09:00 am ‚Äì 10:00 am
~5 km / 3 mile double-loop around the garden.

Grass and dirt track, with slightly uneven footing. Watch your step! We encourage everyone to participate who can, whether you jog or race.
Award ceremony

10:00 am - 11:00 am
Awards to the top finishers in the male, female, and masters (45+) categories.
Lingering festivities

11:00 am - 2:00 pm
Adieu.

articles.title: Travel
articles.contents:
There will be guest parking at the venue.
If you can‚Äôt drive / bike to the venue, consider any of the following options:
Air
Boston Logan International Airport (BOS),
with global service.
Manchester-Boston Regional Airport (MHT).
serviced by American, United, and Southwest.
Lebanon Municipal Airport (LEB),
serviced by Cape Air with flights from BOS (JetBlue codeshare) and White Plains (HPN).
There is little convenience to these flights over ground transportation,
but the small planes do make for a memorable experience.
Ground
Bus
The Dartmouth Coach provides service from Boston or NYC to Lebanon/Hanover, NH.
It is one of the finest motorcoach experiences around, operated by seasoned drivers with gravitas.
Boston service picks up at Logan Airport (BOS) or South Station.
New York service leaves from Midtown Manhattan between Lexington and 3rd Avenue at 150 East 42nd Street, New York, NY 10017.
Dartmouth Coach route map.Train
The Amtrak Vermonter Line is slated to resume service on July 19.
Northbound service arrives to the Windsor, VT station at 5:56 pm daily.
Southbound service departs Windsor at 11:56 am daily.
The Windsor, VT Amtrack station is just 3 miles from the Venue!
The White River Junction Amtrak station is further north,
and is better if you‚Äôd like to stop by Norwich, VT or Hanover, NH before of after the event.
Route Map of the Amtrak Vermonter Line. Destinations outlined in green.Carpool
For guests that don‚Äôt have a car or need a local pick-up,
hopefully we can help coordinate that with other guests.
If you think you will need a ride or might be able to offer a ride,
put your information in this spreadsheet.
Lodging
See Camping for on-site and off-site lodging info.
Map

articles.title: Venue
articles.contents:
The event will be at the Path of Life Sculpture Garden,
which is operated by Great River Outfitters.
The venue is located in Artisan‚Äôs Park, a ‚Äúcollection of 8 unique Vermont businesses.‚Äù
Once at Artisan‚Äôs Park, you enter the garden through the Great River Outfitters shop,
passing under the railroad tracks via the Tunnel of Oblivion.
The garden is enclosed on one side by the New England Central Railroad and the other by the mighty Connecticut River.
Address:
36 Park Road, Windsor, Vermont 05089
On Google Maps
On OpenStreetMap
Venue Contact:
Shop Phone: +1-802-674-9933
Craig‚Äôs Cell: +1-802-345-8248
Notes
No pets allowed
Windsor, VT is part of the Upper Valley region, where Daniel grew up.
Sculpture guide
Sculpture garden history
Additional photos
Looking north from the beach.Solar bag setup for shower.We have reserved four ‚Äúdeluxe tents‚Äù with cots and sleeping bags for at least 6 persons/tent. This is a good option if you do not have a tent. See Camping.Test run. The path will be more groomed on the day of the race.One of the sculpture works.

articles.title: Thi·ªáp m·ªùi
articles.contents:
√îng b√†:

L√™ ƒê√¨nh LƒÉng
Nguy·ªÖn Th·ªã H√†

V≈©ng T√†u, B√† R·ªãa ‚Äî V≈©ng T√†u


√îng b√†:

Marty Himmelstein
Becky Hirschey

Hanover, NH



Tr√¢n tr·ªçng b√°o tin L·ªÖ Th√†nh H√¥n c·ªßa con ch√∫ng t√¥i:


Daniel Himmelstein


&


L√™ Th·∫£o Trang



H√¥n l·ªÖ s·∫Ω ƒë∆∞·ª£c c·ª≠ h√†nh t·∫°i/
The celebration will be at


Palace Hotel

1 Nguy·ªÖn Tr√£i, Ph∆∞·ªùng 1, th√†nh ph·ªë V≈©ng T√†u



v√†o l√∫c 18 gi·ªù 30 ph√∫t

Th·ª© Hai, ng√†y 26 th√°ng 12 nƒÉm 2022
Monday, December 26, 2022
(nh·∫±m ng√†y 04 th√°ng 12 nƒÉm Nh√¢m D·∫ßn)


S·ª± hi·ªán di·ªán c·ªßa qu√Ω kh√°ch l√† ni·ªÅm vinh h·∫°nh cho gia ƒë√¨nh ch√∫ng t√¥i.
Tr√¢n tr·ªçng k√≠nh m·ªùi!

For alien visitors
Welcome!
We‚Äôre thrilled that you‚Äôre coming to visit Trang‚Äôs beautiful hometown!
We‚Äôre working on a Viet Nam must-read Notion page.
We include some crucial information below, but please check out the Notion page for more detail.
And, of course, let us know if you have any additional questions.
Events
You‚Äôre invited to two official events on Monday, December 26,
both in the peninsular city of V≈©ng T√†u where one can watch both sunrise and sunset over the ocean.
First is the morning engagement ceremony called ƒê√°m H·ªèi,
where the groom‚Äôs family & friends present dowric offerings to the bride‚Äôs family
(at their residence).
Second is the evening wedding reception at the Palace Hotel.

Lodging
If you would like to stay at the 4-star Palace Hotel,
you can book via Priceline, Booking.com, Expedia, etc.
The nightly rate is around $50 including breakfast.
There are a few AirBnB options but they can be a little further away from city center.

The hotel finds it too logistically challenging to offer any group discount.
Travel
We will be in Viet Nam from Nov 27 to Dec 28, 2022.
Let us know when you arrive so Trang can be your guide for a few days!
Vung Tau
The closest airport to Vung Tau is SGN (Saigon / Ho Chi Minh City).
To get to Vung Tau, there are shuttles from the airport every 20 mins or so, unless you arrive at a strange time.
You should see a shuttle lane when you get outside.
Make sure to tell them you‚Äôre going to Vung Tau.
Cost is ~$10/person and the shuttle will take you to your exact address.
Depending on traffic, travel time is 2‚Äî2.5 hours.
Some popular shuttle companies are: Hoa Mai, Thanh Vinh, Toan Thang, Huy Hoang, and Anh Quoc.
Hoi An
H·ªôi An is a site of world heritage in central Vietnam.
We have booked group lodging in a 7 bedroom villa overlooking the rice paddies for anyone who‚Äôd like to join.
The villa is reserved from December 16‚Äì22 (Friday‚ÄìThursday).
The villa is in the C·∫©m Thanh village and is referred to as ‚ÄúThe An Retreat Hoi An by ƒê·∫∑ng Vi·∫øt ƒê·ªìng‚Äù.
Details can be found on facebook and airbnb.
We‚Äôll try to acquire world-class amenities:
an occasional private chef and bicycles for all.
The GPS location is 15.88536, 108.35432
(see on Google or OpenStreetMap),
which is roughly this address:

T·ªëng VƒÉn S∆∞∆°ng, Hamlet 5
H·ªôi An, Qu·∫£ng Nam 560000, Vietnam

To get to H·ªôi An, fly to ƒê√† N·∫µng Airport (DAD).
This will be a cheap domestic flight and is probably easiest to book separately from your flight to Vietnam.
Vi·ªát Nam visa
Foreign visitors will need a visa.
If your stay does not exceed 30 days and includes only a single entry into Vietnam,
you can get an e-visa here.
The e-visa process is entirely online, takes ~3 days to process, and costs $25.
We recommend paying with a credit card with no foreign transaction fee.
For other types of visas, see the USA Embassy site for more information.
We will provide you with the contact details for Trang‚Äôs father,
should the visa requires a sponsor or destination address.
Please let us know if you have any further questions!
Reading:
Vietnam International Travel Information (state.gov)
vietnamembassy-usa.org
Monie
1 USD ~= 23,000 VND
The best way to get Viet Nam Dong (VND) is from an ATM, so bring a debit card!
We‚Äôre not sure how much the Exchange Booths in Viet Nam overcharge you, but we generally avoid them at other airports!
There are 2 ATMs in the arrivals hall at SGN airport: a BIDV and a citibank, facing each other.
If you‚Äôre taking a taxi from the airport, you can also ask them to stop at an ATM on the way to your destination.
The ATM fee is usually ~3% of the amount you withdraw.
We also recommend bringing some USD cash with you from the US.
You can always go to any bank in Viet Nam to exchange to VND
(no fee, unlike the Exchange Booth).


There is no limit but if you‚Äôre bringing more than $5,000, be sure to declare at customs.
Reading:
ATMs in Ho Chi Minh City | i Tour Vietnam Blogs (itourvn.com)
How NOT to get scammed at Saigon Airport (theworldinmypocket.co.uk)
Meet the aliens




Isabelle received her doctorate degree at Harvard where she constructed indicators using feature engineering to characterize decentralization as a latent variable and its relationship with program performance.

She can‚Äôt wait for an adventurous time in Viet Nam sans children.





Antoine is the father of two beautiful children, at least one of whom is with Isabelle.
He is thrilled to be making his Loveroo Club debut.





Jason is an avid skier who also dabbles in competitive ultimate, marathon running, and gravel biking.
Jason ƒÉn chay and cannot wait to explore what the Viet cuisine has to offer.





Robert is a Cornell graduate and has been one of Elon Musk‚Äôs best mentees for several years.
Robert is passionate about renewable energy and wishes to invest in solar panels for Southeast Asia.





Nathaly a chemical engineer who speaks 4 languages and cooks 12 different cuisines.
She was last seen in Mexico but you may find her hosting an impromptu dinner in the Greater Philadelphia Area region.
Nathaly is excited to visit Viet Nam and 5 more other countries on her way there.





Luis will be meeting Trang and Daniel for the first time in Viet Nam.
He looks forward to be completely showered with strangers‚Äô love.





Isabel is a published author!
For readers who can read Spanish, there will be a book signing by the beach after the celebration.
Congratulations, Isabel!





Ariel is a Cuban engineer who is expecting!
Ariel is excited to be back to play witness in his third Loveroo union.





Kurt is a free Philadelphian spirit who officiated out first two weddings.
He is excited to enjoy this year‚Äôs celebration without any responsibility.
